title: Predict: k-NN Complexity and k Value
story: Smaller k = more complex boundaries = risk overfitting. Larger k = smoother boundaries = risk underfitting.
instructions: Which k creates MORE complex decision boundaries? k=1 or k=7? Print the k value (1 or 7).
starterCode:
# k=1: Each point creates its own region (very complex, sensitive to noise)
# k=7: Averages 7 neighbors (smoother, less complex)

# k=1 is more complex
print(1)

tests.description: Should print 1 (k=1 creates most complex boundaries)

hints.text: k=1 uses only 1 neighbor (very sensitive, complex). k=7 averages 7 (smoother).
Smaller k → more complex → overfitting risk. Larger k → simpler → underfitting risk.
